pageContext.claim: “You go to California, which has so many sanctuary cities. They don't know what’s happening out there. You have people that want to get rid of those sanctuary cities. They just aren't able to do it with the people that get elected a lot of illegal voting going on out there, by the way. A lot of illegal voting.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump, apparently still annoyed he lost the popular vote in the 2016 election, makes a baseless claim that undocumented immigrants are illegally voting in so-called sanctuary cities. (He has tried to explain away his loss by claiming without evidence that there were millions of illegal votes cast.) Ironically, he made this claim during a rally for a special election -- needed because the congressional race had to be redone because of a Republican ballot-tampering scheme.
